comment:
/**
     * Base class.
     * @global
     * @class
     * @name Api
     */
name: Api
description: Base class.

comment:
/**
     * @typedef {Object} ContentControl
	 * Content control object.
     * @property {string} Tag - A tag assigned to the content control. The same tag can be assigned to several content controls so that it is possible to make reference to them in your code.
     * @property {string} Id - A unique identifier of the content control. It can be used to search for a certain content control and make reference to it in the code.
     * @property {ContentControlLock} Lock - A value that defines if it is possible to delete and/or edit the content control or not: 0 - only deleting, 1 - no deleting or editing, 2 - only editing, 3 - full access.
     * @property {string} InternalId - A unique internal identifier of the content control. It is used for all operations with content controls.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/ContentControl.js
	 */
name: ContentControl

properties.name: Tag
properties.description: A tag assigned to the content control. The same tag can be assigned to several content controls so that it is possible to make reference to them in your code.

properties.name: Id
properties.description: A unique identifier of the content control. It can be used to search for a certain content control and make reference to it in the code.

properties.name: Lock
properties.description: A value that defines if it is possible to delete and/or edit the content control or not: 0 - only deleting, 1 - no deleting or editing, 2 - only editing, 3 - full access.

properties.name: InternalId
properties.description: A unique internal identifier of the content control. It is used for all operations with content controls.

comment: /** * @typedef {(0 | 1 | 2 | 3)} ContentControlLock * A value that defines if it is possible to delete and/or edit the content control or not: * 0 - only deleting * 1 - disable deleting or editing * 2 - only editing * 3 - full access * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/ContentControlLock.js */
name: ContentControlLock

comment: /** * @typedef {(1 | 2 | 3 | 4)} ContentControlType * A numeric value that specifies the content control type: * 1 - block content control * 2 - inline content control * 3 - row content control * 4 - cell content control * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/ContentControlType.js */
name: ContentControlType

comment:
/**
     * @typedef {Object} ContentControlPropertiesAndContent
     * The content control properties and contents.
     * @property  {ContentControlProperties} [ContentControlProperties = {}] - The content control properties.
     * @property  {string} Script - A script that will be executed to generate the data within the content control (can be replaced with the *Url* parameter).
     * @property  {string} Url - A link to the shared file (can be replaced with the *Script* parameter).
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/ContentControlPropertiesAndContent.js
	 */
name: ContentControlPropertiesAndContent

properties.name: ContentControlProperties
properties.description: The content control properties.

properties.name: Script
properties.description: A script that will be executed to generate the data within the content control (can be replaced with the *Url* parameter).

properties.name: Url
properties.description: A link to the shared file (can be replaced with the *Script* parameter).

comment:
/**
     * @typedef {Object} ContentControlProperties
	 * The content control properties.
     * @property {string} Id - A unique identifier of the content control. It can be used to search for a certain content control and make reference to it in the code.
     * @property {string} Tag - A tag assigned to the content control. The same tag can be assigned to several content controls so that it is possible to make reference to them in the code.
     * @property {ContentControlLock} Lock - A value that defines if it is possible to delete and/or edit the content control or not.
     * @property {string} InternalId - A unique internal identifier of the content control.
	 * @property {string} Alias - The alias attribute.
	 * @property {string} PlaceHolderText - The content control placeholder text.
     * @property {number} Appearance - Defines if the content control is shown as the bounding box (**1**) or not (**2**).
     * @property {object} Color - The color for the current content control in the RGB format.
     * @property {number} Color.R - Red color component value.
     * @property {number} Color.G - Green color component value.
     * @property {number} Color.B - Blue color component value.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/ContentControlProperties.js
	 */
name: ContentControlProperties

properties.name: Id
properties.description: A unique identifier of the content control. It can be used to search for a certain content control and make reference to it in the code.

properties.name: Tag
properties.description: A tag assigned to the content control. The same tag can be assigned to several content controls so that it is possible to make reference to them in the code.

properties.name: Lock
properties.description: A value that defines if it is possible to delete and/or edit the content control or not.

properties.name: InternalId
properties.description: A unique internal identifier of the content control.

properties.name: Alias
properties.description: The alias attribute.

properties.name: PlaceHolderText
properties.description: The content control placeholder text.

properties.name: Appearance
properties.description: Defines if the content control is shown as the bounding box (**1**) or not (**2**).

properties.name: Color
properties.description: The color for the current content control in the RGB format.

properties.name: Color.R
properties.description: Red color component value.

properties.name: Color.G
properties.description: Green color component value.

properties.name: Color.B
properties.description: Blue color component value.

comment: /** * @typedef {('none' | 'comments' | 'forms' | 'readOnly')} DocumentEditingRestrictions * The document editing restrictions: * none - no editing restrictions, * comments - allows editing comments, * forms - allows editing form fields, * readOnly - does not allow editing. * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/DocumentEditingRestrictions.js */
name: DocumentEditingRestrictions

comment: /** * @typedef {("entirely" | "beforeCursor" | "afterCursor")} TextPartType * Specifies if the whole text or only its part will be returned or replaced: * entirely - replaces/returns the whole text, * beforeCursor - replaces/returns only the part of the text before the cursor, * afterCursor - replaces/returns only the part of the text after the cursor. * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/TextPartType.js */
name: TextPartType

comment:
/**
     * Opens a file with fields.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias OpenFile
     * @param {Uint8Array} binaryFile - A file in the format of the 8-bit unsigned integer array.
     * @param {string[]} fields - A list of field values.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/OpenFile.js
	 */
name: OpenFile

params.name: binaryFile
params.description: A file in the format of the 8-bit unsigned integer array.

params.name: fields
params.description: A list of field values.

comment:
/**
     * Returns all fields as a text.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias GetFields
     * @returns {string[]} - A list of field values.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/GetFields.js
	 */
name: GetFields

comment:
/**
     * Inserts the content control containing data. The data is specified by the JS code for {@link /docbuilder/basic Document Builder}, or by a link to the shared document.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias InsertAndReplaceContentControls
     * @param {ContentControlPropertiesAndContent[]} arrDocuments - An array of properties and contents of the content control.
     * @return {ContentControlProperties[]} - An array of created content control properties.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/InsertAndReplaceContentControls.js
	 */
name: InsertAndReplaceContentControls

params.name: arrDocuments
params.description: An array of properties and contents of the content control.

comment:
/**
     * Removes several content controls.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias RemoveContentControls
     * @param {ContentControl[]} arrDocuments - An array of content control internal IDs. Example: [{"InternalId": "5_556"}].
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/RemoveContentControls.js
	 */
name: RemoveContentControls

params.name: arrDocuments
params.description: An array of content control internal IDs. Example: [{"InternalId": "5_556"}].

comment:
/**
     * Returns information about all the content controls that have been added to the page.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias GetAllContentControls
     * @returns {ContentControl[]} - An array of content control objects.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/GetAllContentControls.js
	 */
name: GetAllContentControls

comment:
/**
     * @typedef {Object} ContentControlParentPr
     * The content control parent properties.
     * @property  {object} Parent - The content control parent. For example, oParagraph.
     * @property  {number} Pos - The content control position within the parent object.
     * @property  {number} Count - A number of elements in the parent object.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/ContentControlParentPr.js
	 */
name: ContentControlParentPr

properties.name: Parent
properties.description: The content control parent. For example, oParagraph.

properties.name: Pos
properties.description: The content control position within the parent object.

properties.name: Count
properties.description: A number of elements in the parent object.

comment:
/**
     * Removes the currently selected content control retaining all its contents. The content control where the mouse cursor is currently positioned will be removed.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias RemoveContentControl
     * @param {string} InternalId - A unique internal identifier of the content control.
     * @returns {ContentControlParentPr} - An object which contains the following values: Parent - content control parent, Pos - content control position within the parent object, Count - a number of elements in the parent object.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/RemoveContentControl.js
	 */
name: RemoveContentControl

params.name: InternalId
params.description: A unique internal identifier of the content control.

comment:
/**
     * Returns an identifier of the selected content control (i.e. the content control where the mouse cursor is currently positioned).
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias GetCurrentContentControl
     * @returns {string} - The content control internal ID.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/GetCurrentContentControl.js
	 */
name: GetCurrentContentControl

comment:
/**
     * Returns the current content control properties.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias GetCurrentContentControlPr
	 * @param {string} contentFormat - The content format ("none", "text", "html", "ole" or "desktop").
     * @returns {ContentControlProperties} - The content control properties.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/GetCurrentContentControlPr.js
	 */
name: GetCurrentContentControlPr

params.name: contentFormat
params.description: The content format ("none", "text", "html", "ole" or "desktop").

comment:
/**
     * Selects the specified content control.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias SelectContentControl
     * @param {string} id - A unique internal identifier of the content control.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/SelectContentControl.js
	 */
name: SelectContentControl

params.name: id
params.description: A unique internal identifier of the content control.

comment:
/**
     * Moves a cursor to the specified content control.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias MoveCursorToContentControl
     * @param {string} id - A unique internal identifier of the content control.
     * @param {boolean} [isBegin = false] - Defines if the cursor position changes in the content control. By default, a cursor will be placed to the content control begin (**false**).
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/MoveCursorToContentControl.js
	 */
name: MoveCursorToContentControl

params.name: id
params.description: A unique internal identifier of the content control.

params.name: isBegin
params.description: Defines if the cursor position changes in the content control. By default, a cursor will be placed to the content control begin (**false**).

comment:
/**
     * Removes the selected content from the document.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias RemoveSelectedContent
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/RemoveSelectedContent.js
	 */
name: RemoveSelectedContent

comment:
/**
	 * @typedef {Object} comment
	 * Comment object.
	 * @property {string} Id - The comment ID.
	 * @property {CommentData} Data - An object which contains the comment data.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/comment.js
	 */
name: comment

properties.name: Id
properties.description: The comment ID.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: An object which contains the comment data.

comment:
/**
	 * @typedef {Object} CommentData
	 * The comment data.
	 * @property {string} UserName - The comment author.
	 * @property {string} QuoteText - The quote comment text.
	 * @property {string} Text - The comment text.
	 * @property {string} Time - The time when the comment was posted (in milliseconds).
	 * @property {boolean} Solved - Specifies if the comment is resolved (**true**) or not (**false**).
	 * @property {CommentData[]} Replies - An array containing the comment replies represented as the *CommentData* object.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/CommentData.js
	 */
name: CommentData

properties.name: UserName
properties.description: The comment author.

properties.name: QuoteText
properties.description: The quote comment text.

properties.name: Text
properties.description: The comment text.

properties.name: Time
properties.description: The time when the comment was posted (in milliseconds).

properties.name: Solved
properties.description: Specifies if the comment is resolved (**true**) or not (**false**).

properties.name: Replies
properties.description: An array containing the comment replies represented as the *CommentData* object.

comment:
/**
	 * Adds a comment to the document.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias AddComment
	 * @param {CommentData}  oCommentData - An object which contains the comment data.
	 * @return {string | null} - The comment ID in the string format or null if the comment cannot be added.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/AddComment.js
	 */
name: AddComment

params.name: oCommentData
params.description: An object which contains the comment data.

comment: /** * Moves a cursor to the beginning of the current editing area (document body, footer/header, footnote, or autoshape). * This method is similar to pressing the Ctrl + Home keyboard shortcut. * @memberof Api * @typeofeditors ["CDE"] * @alias MoveCursorToStart * @param {boolean} isMoveToMainContent - This flag ignores the current position and always moves a cursor to the beginning of the document body. * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/MoveCursorToStart.js */
name: MoveCursorToStart

params.name: isMoveToMainContent
params.description: This flag ignores the current position and always moves a cursor to the beginning of the document body.

comment: /** * Moves a cursor to the end of the current editing area (document body, footer/header, footnote, or autoshape). * This method is similar to pressing the Ctrl + End keyboard shortcut. * @memberof Api * @typeofeditors ["CDE"] * @alias MoveCursorToEnd * @param {boolean} isMoveToMainContent - This flag ignores the current position and always moves a cursor to the end of the document body. * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/MoveCursorToEnd.js */
name: MoveCursorToEnd

params.name: isMoveToMainContent
params.description: This flag ignores the current position and always moves a cursor to the end of the document body.

comment:
/**
     * Finds and replaces the text.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias SearchAndReplace
     * @param {Object} oProperties - An object which contains the search and replacement strings.
     * @param {string} oProperties.searchString - The search string.
     * @param {string} oProperties.replaceString - The replacement string.
     * @param {boolean} [oProperties.matchCase=true] - Case sensitive or not.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/SearchAndReplace.js
	 */
name: SearchAndReplace

params.name: oProperties
params.description: An object which contains the search and replacement strings.

params.name: oProperties.searchString
params.description: The search string.

params.name: oProperties.replaceString
params.description: The replacement string.

params.name: oProperties.matchCase
params.description: Case sensitive or not.

comment:
/**
	 * Finds and selects the next occurrence of the text starting at the current position.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias SearchNext
	 * @param {Object} oProperties - An object which contains the search string.
	 * @param {string} oProperties.searchString - The search string.
	 * @param {boolean} [oProperties.matchCase=true] - Case sensitive or not.
	 * @param {boolean} [isForward=true] - Search direction.
	 * @returns {boolean} returns false if text was not found
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/SearchNext.js
	 */
name: SearchNext

params.name: oProperties
params.description: An object which contains the search string.

params.name: oProperties.searchString
params.description: The search string.

params.name: oProperties.matchCase
params.description: Case sensitive or not.

params.name: isForward
params.description: Search direction.

comment:
/**
     * Returns file content in the HTML format.
     * @memberof Api
     * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
     * @alias GetFileHTML
     * @return {string} - The HTML file content in the string format.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/GetFileHTML.js
	 */
name: GetFileHTML

comment:
/**
	 * Returns all the comments from the document.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias GetAllComments
	 * @returns {comment[]} - An array of comment objects containing the comment data.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/GetAllComments.js
	 */
name: GetAllComments

comment:
/**
	 * Removes the specified comments.
	 * @param {string[]} arrIds - An array which contains the IDs of the specified comments.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias RemoveComments
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/RemoveComments.js
	 */
name: RemoveComments

params.name: arrIds
params.description: An array which contains the IDs of the specified comments.

comment:
/**
	 * Changes the specified comment.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias ChangeComment
	 * @param {string} sId - The comment ID.
	 * @param {CommentData} oCommentData - An object which contains the new comment data.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/ChangeComment.js
	 */
name: ChangeComment

params.name: sId
params.description: The comment ID.

params.name: oCommentData
params.description: An object which contains the new comment data.

comment:
/**
	 * Moves a cursor to the specified comment.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias MoveToComment
	 * @param {string} sId - The comment ID.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/MoveToComment.js
	 */
name: MoveToComment

params.name: sId
params.description: The comment ID.

comment: /** * Sets the display mode for track changes. * @memberof Api * @typeofeditors ["CDE"] * @alias SetDisplayModeInReview * @param {string} [sMode="edit"] - The display mode: * edit - all changes are displayed, * simple - all changes are displayed but the balloons are turned off, * final - all accepted changes are displayed, * original - all rejected changes are displayed. * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/SetDisplayModeInReview.js */
name: SetDisplayModeInReview

params.name: sMode
params.description: The display mode: edit - all changes are displayed, simple - all changes are displayed but the balloons are turned off, final - all accepted changes are displayed, original - all rejected changes are displayed.

comment: /** * Adds an empty content control to the document. * @memberof Api * @typeofeditors ["CDE"] * @alias AddContentControl * @param {ContentControlType} type - A numeric value that specifies the content control type. It can have one of the following values: 1 (block), 2 (inline), 3 (row), or 4 (cell). * @param {ContentControlProperties} [commonPr = {}] - The common content control properties. * @returns {ContentControl} - A JSON object containing the data about the created content control. * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/AddContentControl.js */
name: AddContentControl

params.name: type
params.description: A numeric value that specifies the content control type. It can have one of the following values: 1 (block), 2 (inline), 3 (row), or 4 (cell).

params.name: commonPr
params.description: The common content control properties.

comment:
/**
	 * @typedef {Object} ContentControlCheckBoxProperties
	 * The content control checkbox properties.
	 * @property {boolean} Checked - Defines if the content control checkbox is checked or not.
	 * @property {number} CheckedSymbol - A symbol in the HTML code format that is used when the checkbox is checked.
	 * @property {number} UncheckedSymbol - A symbol in the HTML code format that is used when the checkbox is not checked.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/ContentControlCheckBoxProperties.js
	 */
name: ContentControlCheckBoxProperties

properties.name: Checked
properties.description: Defines if the content control checkbox is checked or not.

properties.name: CheckedSymbol
properties.description: A symbol in the HTML code format that is used when the checkbox is checked.

properties.name: UncheckedSymbol
properties.description: A symbol in the HTML code format that is used when the checkbox is not checked.

comment:
/**
	 * Adds an empty content control checkbox to the document.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias AddContentControlCheckBox
	 * @param {ContentControlCheckBoxProperties}  [checkBoxPr = {}] - The content control checkbox properties.
	 * @param {ContentControlProperties}  [commonPr = {}] - The common content control properties.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/AddContentControlCheckBox.js
	 */
name: AddContentControlCheckBox

params.name: checkBoxPr
params.description: The content control checkbox properties.

params.name: commonPr
params.description: The common content control properties.

comment:
/**
	 * Adds an empty content control picture to the document.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias AddContentControlPicture
	 * @param {ContentControlProperties}  [commonPr = {}] - The common content control properties.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/AddContentControlPicture.js
	 */
name: AddContentControlPicture

params.name: commonPr
params.description: The common content control properties.

comment: /** * Adds an empty content control list to the document. * @memberof Api * @typeofeditors ["CDE"] * @alias AddContentControlList * @param {ContentControlType} type - A numeric value that specifies the content control type. It can have one of the following values: 1 (combo box), 0 (dropdown list). * @param {Array} [List = [{Display, Value}]] - A list of the content control elements that consists of two items: Display - an item that will be displayed to the user in the content control list, Value - a value of each item from the content control list. * @param {ContentControlProperties} [commonPr = {}] - The common content control properties. * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/AddContentControlList.js */
name: AddContentControlList

params.name: type
params.description: A numeric value that specifies the content control type. It can have one of the following values: 1 (combo box), 0 (dropdown list).

params.name: List
params.description: A list of the content control elements that consists of two items: Display - an item that will be displayed to the user in the content control list, Value - a value of each item from the content control list.

params.name: commonPr
params.description: The common content control properties.

comment:
/**
	 * @typedef {Object} ContentControlDatePickerProperties
	 * The content control datepicker properties.
	 * @property {string} DateFormat - A format in which the date will be displayed.
	 * For example: *"MM/DD/YYYY", "dddd\,\ mmmm\ dd\,\ yyyy", "DD\ MMMM\ YYYY", "MMMM\ DD\,\ YYYY", "DD-MMM-YY", "MMMM\ YY", "MMM-YY", "MM/DD/YYYY\ hh:mm\ AM/PM", "MM/DD/YYYY\ hh:mm:ss\ AM/PM", "hh:mm", "hh:mm:ss", "hh:mm\ AM/PM", "hh:mm:ss:\ AM/PM"*.
	 * @property {object} Date - The current date and time.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/ContentControlDatePickerProperties.js
	 */
name: ContentControlDatePickerProperties

properties.name: DateFormat
properties.description:
A format in which the date will be displayed.
For example: *"MM/DD/YYYY", "dddd\,\ mmmm\ dd\,\ yyyy", "DD\ MMMM\ YYYY", "MMMM\ DD\,\ YYYY", "DD-MMM-YY", "MMMM\ YY", "MMM-YY", "MM/DD/YYYY\ hh:mm\ AM/PM", "MM/DD/YYYY\ hh:mm:ss\ AM/PM", "hh:mm", "hh:mm:ss", "hh:mm\ AM/PM", "hh:mm:ss:\ AM/PM"*.

properties.name: Date
properties.description: The current date and time.

comment:
/**
	 * Adds an empty content control datepicker to the document.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias AddContentControlDatePicker
	 * @param {ContentControlDatePickerProperties}  [datePickerPr = {}] - The content control datepicker properties.
	 * @param {ContentControlProperties}  [commonPr = {}] - The common content control properties.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/AddContentControlDatePicker.js
	 */
name: AddContentControlDatePicker

params.name: datePickerPr
params.description: The content control datepicker properties.

params.name: commonPr
params.description: The common content control properties.

comment:
/**
	 * @typedef {Object} OLEObjectData
	 * The OLE object data.
	 * @property {string} Data - OLE object data (internal format).
	 * @property {string} ImageData - An image in the base64 format stored in the OLE object and used by the plugin.
	 * @property {string} ApplicationId - An identifier of the plugin which can edit the current OLE object and must be of the *asc.{UUID}* type.
	 * @property {string} InternalId - The OLE object identifier which is used to work with OLE object added to the document.
	 * @property {string} ParaDrawingId - An identifier of the drawing object containing the current OLE object.
	 * @property {number} Width - The OLE object width measured in millimeters.
	 * @property {number} Height - The OLE object height measured in millimeters.
	 * @property {?number} WidthPix - The OLE object image width in pixels.
	 * @property {?number} HeightPix - The OLE object image height in pixels.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/OLEObjectData.js
	 */
name: OLEObjectData

properties.name: Data
properties.description: OLE object data (internal format).

properties.name: ImageData
properties.description: An image in the base64 format stored in the OLE object and used by the plugin.

properties.name: ApplicationId
properties.description: An identifier of the plugin which can edit the current OLE object and must be of the *asc.{UUID}* type.

properties.name: InternalId
properties.description: The OLE object identifier which is used to work with OLE object added to the document.

properties.name: ParaDrawingId
properties.description: An identifier of the drawing object containing the current OLE object.

properties.name: Width
properties.description: The OLE object width measured in millimeters.

properties.name: Height
properties.description: The OLE object height measured in millimeters.

properties.name: WidthPix
properties.description: The OLE object image width in pixels.

properties.name: HeightPix
properties.description: The OLE object image height in pixels.

comment:
/**
	 * @typedef {Object} AddinFieldData
	 * The addin field data.
	 * @property {string} FieldId - Field identifier.
	 * @property {string} Value - Field value.
	 * @property {string} Content - Field text content.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Enumeration/AddinFieldData.js
	 */
name: AddinFieldData

properties.name: FieldId
properties.description: Field identifier.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: Field value.

properties.name: Content
properties.description: Field text content.

examples:
var oAddinFieldData = {"FieldId": "1", "Value": "Addin 1", "Content": "This is the first addin field"};
window.Asc.plugin.executeMethod("AddAddinField", [oAddinFieldData]);

comment:
/**
	 * Returns all OLE object data for objects which can be opened by the specified plugin.
	 * If *sPluginId* is not defined, this method returns all OLE objects contained in the currrent document.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias GetAllOleObjects
	 * @param {?string} sPluginId - Plugin identifier. It must be of the *asc.{UUID}* type.
	 * @returns {OLEObjectData[]} - An array of the OLEObjectData objects containing the data about the OLE object parameters.
	 * @since 7.1.0
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/GetAllOleObjects.js
	 */
name: GetAllOleObjects

params.name: sPluginId
params.description: Plugin identifier. It must be of the *asc.{UUID}* type.

comment:
/**
	 * Removes the OLE object from the document by its internal ID.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias RemoveOleObject
	 * @param {string} sInternalId - The OLE object identifier which is used to work with OLE object added to the document.
	 * @since 7.1.0
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/RemoveOleObject.js
	 */
name: RemoveOleObject

params.name: sInternalId
params.description: The OLE object identifier which is used to work with OLE object added to the document.

comment:
/**
	 * Removes several OLE objects from the document by their internal IDs.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias RemoveOleObjects
	 * @param {OLEObjectData[]} arrObjects An array of the identifiers which are used to work with OLE objects added to the document. Example: [{"InternalId": "5_556"}].
	 * @since 7.1.0
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/RemoveOleObjects.js
	 */
name: RemoveOleObjects

params.name: arrObjects
params.description: An array of the identifiers which are used to work with OLE objects added to the document. Example: [{"InternalId": "5_556"}].

comment:
/**
	 * Selects the specified OLE object.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias SelectOleObject
	 * @param {string} id - The OLE object identifier which is used to work with OLE object added to the document.
	 * @since 7.1.0
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/SelectOleObject.js
	 */
name: SelectOleObject

params.name: id
params.description: The OLE object identifier which is used to work with OLE object added to the document.

comment:
/**
	 * Inserts the OLE object at the current document position.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias InsertOleObject
	 * @param {OLEObjectData} NewObject - The OLEObjectData object.
	 * @param {?boolean} bSelect - Defines if the OLE object will be selected after inserting into the document (**true**) or not (**false**).
	 * @since 7.1.0
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/InsertOleObject.js
	 */
name: InsertOleObject
description:
Inserts the OLE object at the current document position.

## Try it

 ```js document-builder={"documentType": "word"}
window.Asc.plugin.executeMethod ("InsertOleObject", [
    {
        "Data": "{data}",
        "ImageData": "data:image/png;base64,image-in-the-base64-format",
        "ApplicationId": "asc.{38E022EA-AD92-45FC-B22B-49DF39746DB4}",
        "Width": 70,
        "Height": 70,
        "WidthPix": 60 * 36000,
        "HeightPix": 60 * 36000
    },
true]);
```

params.name: NewObject
params.description: The OLEObjectData object.

params.name: bSelect
params.description: Defines if the OLE object will be selected after inserting into the document (**true**) or not (**false**).

comment:
/**
	 * Changes the OLE object with the *InternalId* specified in OLE object data.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias ChangeOleObject
	 * @param {OLEObjectData} ObjectData - The OLEObjectData object.
	 * @since 7.1.0
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/ChangeOleObject.js
	 */
name: ChangeOleObject
description:
Changes the OLE object with the *InternalId* specified in OLE object data.

## Try it

 ```js document-builder={"documentType": "word"}
window.Asc.plugin.executeMethod ("ChangeOleObject", [
    {
        "Data": "{data}",
        "ImageData": "data:image/png;base64,image-in-the-base64-format",
        "ApplicationId": "asc.{38E022EA-AD92-45FC-B22B-49DF39746DB4}",
        "InternalId": "5_556",
        "ParaDrawingId": "1_713",
        "Width": 70,
        "Height": 70,
        "WidthPix": 60 * 36000,
        "HeightPix": 60 * 36000
    }
]);
```

params.name: ObjectData
params.description: The OLEObjectData object.

comment:

	 */

description: Undoes the user's last action.

comment:
/**
	 * Reverts the user's last undone action.

	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/Redo.js

description: Reverts the user's last undone action.

comment:
/**

	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/CanUndo.js

name: CanUndo
description: Checks if it is possible to undo the user's last action.

comment:
/**
	 * Checks if it possible to revert the user's last undone action.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias CanRedo
	 * @since 8.2.0
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/{Editor}/Api/Methods/CanRedo.js
	 */
name: CanRedo
description: Checks if it possible to revert the user's last undone action.

comment:
/**
     * @typedef {Object} ContentControl
	 * Content control object.
     * @property {string} Tag - A tag assigned to the content control. The same tag can be assigned to several content controls so that it is possible to make reference to them in your code.
     * @property {string} Id - A unique identifier of the content control. It can be used to search for a certain content control and make reference to it in the code.
     * @property {ContentControlLock} Lock - A value that defines if it is possible to delete and/or edit the content control or not: 0 - only deleting, 1 - no deleting or editing, 2 - only editing, 3 - full access.
     * @property {string} InternalId - A unique internal identifier of the content control. It is used for all operations with content controls.
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/Forms/Enumeration/ContentControl.js
	 */
name: ContentControl

properties.name: Tag
properties.description: A tag assigned to the content control. The same tag can be assigned to several content controls so that it is possible to make reference to them in your code.

properties.name: Id
properties.description: A unique identifier of the content control. It can be used to search for a certain content control and make reference to it in the code.

properties.name: Lock
properties.description: A value that defines if it is possible to delete and/or edit the content control or not: 0 - only deleting, 1 - no deleting or editing, 2 - only editing, 3 - full access.

properties.name: InternalId
properties.description: A unique internal identifier of the content control. It is used for all operations with content controls.

comment:
/**
     * @typedef {(0 | 1 | 2 | 3)} ContentControlLock
     * A value that defines if it is possible to delete and/or edit the content control or not:
	 * **0** - only deleting
	 * **1** - disable deleting or editing
	 * **2** - only editing
	 * **3** - full access
     * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/Forms/Enumeration/ContentControlLock.js
	 */
name: ContentControlLock

comment:
/**
	 * Returns information about all the forms that have been added to the document.

	 * @returns {ContentControl[]} - An array with all the forms from the document.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/Forms/Api/Methods/GetAllForms.js
	 */
name: GetAllForms

comment:
/**
	 * Returns information about all the forms that have been added to the document with specified tag.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias GetFormsByTag
	 * @param {string} tag - The form tag.
	 * @returns {ContentControl[]} - An array with all the forms from the document with the specified tag.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/Forms/Api/Methods/GetFormsByTag.js
	 */
name: GetFormsByTag

params.name: tag
params.description: The form tag.

comment:
/**
	 * Sets a value to the specified form.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias SetFormValue
	 * @param {string} internalId - A unique internal identifier of the form.
	 * @param {string | boolean} value - Form value to be set. Its type depends on the form type.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/Forms/Api/Methods/SetFormValue.js
	 */
name: SetFormValue

params.name: internalId
params.description: A unique internal identifier of the form.

params.name: value
params.description: Form value to be set. Its type depends on the form type.

comment:
/**
	 * Returns a value of the specified form.
	 * @memberof Api
	 * @typeofeditors ["CDE"]
	 * @alias GetFormValue
	 * @param {string} internalId - A unique internal identifier of the form.
	 * @returns {null | string | boolean} The form value in the string or boolean format depending on the form type. The null value means that the form is filled with a placeholder.
	 * @see office-js-api/Examples/Plugins/Forms/Api/Methods/GetFormValue.js
	 */
name: GetFormValue

params.name: internalId
params.description: A unique internal identifier of the form.
